speaker: macbeth
dialog: They have tied me to a stake; I cannot fly, But, bear-like, I must fight the course.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: What's he, That was not born of woman? Such a one, Am I to fear, or none.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: Thou'lt be afraid to hear it.

speaker: siward
dialog: No; though thou call'st thyself a hotter name, Than any is in hell.

speaker: siward
dialog: The devil himself could not pronounce a title, More hateful to mine ear.

speaker: siward
dialog: Thou liest, abhorred tyrant; with my sword, I'll prove the lie thou speak'st.

speaker: macbeth
dialog: Thou wast born of woman, But swords I smile at, weapons laugh to scorn, Brandish'd by man that's of a woman born.
